title: Ticket #6605: Revised regression testing milestones.
description:
While the overall and final goals of the testing program haven't changed, the fact that we added PEAK metrics before finishing the SUM metrics tests means we're doing things in a different order. This ticket supersedes #6543, #6569, and #6554. I'll commit test improvements on this ticket number until the next point release, at which point I may have to create another ticket for the changes to the next point release.

The existing tests are:
  • cmr-monitor-basic and cmr-monitor-basic-partitionable
  • cmr-monitor-memory and cmr-monitor-memory-partitionable
  • cmr-monitor-both and cmr-monitor-both-partitionable

The first tests one SUM metric, the second one PEAK metric, and the third running both at the same time. All three tests test one resource per slot of a single resource type.

To address the comments on the previous tickets:

  • The -partitionable tests check dynamic slots.
  • The cmr-*-ad.cmd files submit eight jobs to a configuration known to have only four resources and check all eight jobs; this checks slot reuse.

The next test will build on cmr-monitor-both. The first step is to run the cmr-monitor-both tests in the presence of another active monitor (also with one resource instance per slot, but now with two resource types). If these pass, the test should be extended to add tests of the second resource's reporting. Once that's done, we can consider how to structure our answer to the next section.

We also need to have a test for multiple SUM and multiple PEAK metrics per monitor. (Although it might make sense to develop a test for each type of metric independently, since we need to test both simultaneously, that may be the only test we actually have/run.) We would then have to test those monitors in the presence of other monitors (resource types) like them (that is, with multiple SUM and PEAK metrics), as well as test multiple resource instances per slot for each resource type.
remarks:
2018-Mar-19 14:53:10 by tlmiller:
It seems, upon further consideration, that the immediate concern is for multiple custom machine resource instances per slot, and not multiple metrics (of either type) per monitor. We shall therefore implement a test in this ticket for the former and punt the latter to another ticket for work as needed.
derived_tickets: #6620   Add tests for multiple SUM and multiple PEAK tests per monitor.
